pitrou commented on issue #6447: ARROW-7764: [C++] Don't keep a null bitmap in ArrayData if null_count == 0
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6447#issuecomment-589651640
 
 
   @wesm Well, from what I've gathered, it looks a bit messy:
   * in `column_reader.cc`, there's `ColumnReaderImplBase::ReadValuesSpaced` vs. `ColumnReaderImplBase::ReadValues`
   * but in the same file, there's also `TypedRecordReader::ReadValuesSpaced` vs. `TypedRecordReader::ReadValuesDense`: why? (note subtly different naming :-))
   
   You'll see that `ReadValuesSpaced` is only called if the Parquet file may have spaced values. But perhaps in some cases the file declares an optional field that in reality is always present, in which case `null_count` ends up 0.
   
   It seems that in `encoding.{h,cc}`, perhaps we could forego the `Decode`/`DecodeSpaced` distinction as well as `DecodeArrow`/`DecodeArrowNonNull`, and instead have the implementation switch to different paths depending on `null_count`. But that's a significant architectural change, and I don't know enough about Parquet to make a decision.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #6447: ARROW-7764: [C++] Don't keep a null bitmap in ArrayData if null_count == 0
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6447#issuecomment-590394570
 
 
   I see. I think the rationale for the Decode/DecodeSpaced distinction is that consumers of the decoded data may or may not want the spaced / Arrow-like memory layout in the decoded data, even when there are nulls. Since the spaced decoding takes extra computational work (the non-null values have to "moved into place") we don't force this semantic on public API users
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6447#issuecomment-591445345
 
 
   What could be done though is merge `DecodeArrow` and `DecodeArrowNonNull` together, since `DecodeArrow` already has to take a different path based on `null_count`.

pitrou commented on issue #6447: ARROW-7764: [C++] Don't keep a null bitmap in ArrayData if null_count == 0
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6447#issuecomment-591924714
 
 
   Note that this PR actually makes some decoding a bit faster:
   * before:
   ```
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrow_Dense/65536            822259 ns       822116 ns         3381 bytes_per_second=457.569M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dense/65536     778227 ns       778096 ns         4015 bytes_per_second=483.455M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrow_Dict/65536            3609862 ns      3609246 ns          771 bytes_per_second=104.225M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dict/65536     3500624 ns      3500022 ns          808 bytes_per_second=107.478M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrow_Dense/65536            2702473 ns      2702013 ns         1035 bytes_per_second=139.22M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dense/65536     2689046 ns      2688489 ns         1034 bytes_per_second=139.921M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrow_Dict/65536             4219876 ns      4219148 ns          670 bytes_per_second=89.159M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dict/65536      4143485 ns      4142749 ns          677 bytes_per_second=90.8032M/s
   ```
   * after:
   ```
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrow_Dense/65536            690074 ns       689951 ns         4069 bytes_per_second=545.22M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dense/65536     692913 ns       692758 ns         4046 bytes_per_second=543.01M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrow_Dict/65536            3275331 ns      3274655 ns          864 bytes_per_second=114.875M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryPlain/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dict/65536     3263202 ns      3262458 ns          852 bytes_per_second=115.304M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrow_Dense/65536            2476155 ns      2475691 ns         1128 bytes_per_second=151.947M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dense/65536     2612045 ns      2611368 ns         1068 bytes_per_second=144.053M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrow_Dict/65536             3986622 ns      3985459 ns          705 bytes_per_second=94.3868M/s
   BM_ArrowBinaryDict/DecodeArrowNonNull_Dict/65536      3973003 ns      3971878 ns          705 bytes_per_second=94.7096M/s
   ```
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description: This is an optimization where we can coalesce to nullptr if there's no null in the array.
fields.summary: [C++] Builders allocate a null bitmap buffer even if there is no nulls
